metadata.title: CVE-2024-26146 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Rack is a modular Ruby web server interface. Carefully crafted headers cancause header parsing in Rack to take longer than expected resulting in apossible denial of service issue. Accept and Forwarded headers areimpacted. Ruby 3.2 has mitigations for this problem, so Rack applicationsusing Ruby 3.2 or newer are unaffected. This vulnerability is fixed in2.0.9.4, 2.1.4.4, 2.2.8.1, and 3.0.9.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26146` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ruby-rack - 2.1.4-5ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-rack package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.4-5ubuntu1.1').
